el socio trabaja en su propia casa el tiene una carpintería y su esposa una chichería en la misma casa, el socio desea el crédito para poder comprar madera al por mayor y poder realizar trabajos como cmas,mesas,puertas y roperos para exhibirlos y venderlos a sus vecinos, el socio trabaja más de 20 años en carpintería y con su propio negocio trabaja 10 años. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar madera. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA", which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

He works out of his own house and has a carpentry business.  His wife runs a chicha bar at home.  The member wants a loan to be able to buy wood wholesale and make tables, doors and armoirs to exhibit and sell to the neighbors.  He has been in carpentry for over 20 years and running his own business for ten.  The loan he is requesting is to buy wood.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is applying for his fourth loan from KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully and his business is doing great. Peter will use the loan to service his vehicle. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy another vehicle and to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 48, is married to Ruth and together they have five children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is his third term loan with KADET Ltd. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. Peter will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings for use on his farm.

He hopes to educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia se dedica la compra y venta de artesanía ella elabora textiles, ella misma se encarga de tejer las mantas, guantes, ponchos, chalinas, todos los textiles, pasadizos muñecas de trapo, ente otros, la socia trabaja en la puerta de un hotel, la socia realiza trabajos como mantas y artesania de diferentes texturas como alpaca, oveja, sintética.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cierres, hilos, tintes para teñir las lanas, botones y otros materiales
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA", which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She buys and sells crafts, and makes her own textiles, such as blankets, gloves, ponchos, shawls, ragdolls, etc.  She works in front of a hotel, and uses different materials such as alpaca, sheepwool,and  synthetic yarn.  The member is requesting a loan to buy closures, yarn, yarn dye, buttons and other materials.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy closures, yarn, yarn dye, buttons and other materials.

loans.name: Joan Many

texts.fr: Many est une jeune femme de 35 ans fiancée, mère de 2 enfants âgés de 1 et 5 ans. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure et petit commerce qu'elle gère depuis 3 ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en: Many is a young 35 year old woman who is engaged to be married and mother of two children, ages 1 and 5.  After her education, she opened a hair salon and small business that she has managed for three years already. She often has the problem of a shortage of cosmetics, hair extensions, and hair transplants at her salon because she buys retail.  Her goal is to satisfy her customers and earn a large profit. She is asking for a loan in order to buy her supplies in large quantities, which will allow her to meet her goals.  The profit from this loan will help her meet her needs, those of her children, and also to save money for the growth of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salon supplies (hair extensions, oils, and gels)

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
With a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), Florence will be able to buy more stock of shoes and cereals. Her goal through this investment is to increase her clientele and the income she earns through her business. Florence is a divorced mother of four children.

Everyday Florence makes every effort to provide the best customer service she can, since competition between cereal stores is huge in her area of operation. She has already established a good customer base. Her customers like her due to her jovial and caring nature. She has been in this line of operation for the last 20 years. She has been a hardworking woman despite her advanced age.

Florence wants to make sure she can provide the best nutrition and improved living standards for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and cereals.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen, 34, has three school-going children. For the past three years, she has been managing and operating a tailoring business. She learned these skills when she attended a tailoring and dressmaking college, one of the village poly-techniques. She buys her clothing materials from the city in the eastern part of the country.

Maureen is seeking this loan so that she can purchase rolls of cloth for making more fashions of clothing. She wants to make this improvement to her display so that she can attract more customers and increase her income. Her underlying goal is to be able to provide her children with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of cloth.

loans.name: C6246 Coojeka Group

texts.en:
Bonifride, 33, is married with one child. She is the leader of this group, which is called "C6246 COOJEKA" in the local language. In the photo, she's the one who is in the blue dress. 

Bonifride has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more chickens for resale. With the profits expected from this loan, she will be able to re-invest in her business, to save money for her future and she will be able to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Gisella

texts.en:
Gisella designs and crafts leather handbags. She would like to buy raw materials and components to be able to create new designs.

Gisella has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I've always had an inclination towards creating things, and I like handicrafts. Several years ago, I began making soaps and candles, and I enrolled in craft classes every chance I had. In 2009, I decided to study jewelry crafting. Later, I studied designing purses and wallets. My greatest challenge has been getting ahead as a woman in a field that has been mostly dominated by men."

"When I design my handbags, I want women to fall in love with them and use them all the time. Thank you so much for your support. I appreciate your confidence and want to thank you all for helping me achieve my dream."

Use the link below to view Gisella's leather bags on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8333

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and components for her leather handbags.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en: Rutchel is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Rutchel  is into making and sewing dresses, uniforms, curtains. She accepts orders in tailoring services, and at the same time she owns a mini retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for six years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to  pay for the maintenance of tailoring service, buy needle, threads and cloth also to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale. Rutchel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rutchel hopes to improve her business so that she can provide the needs of her family, especially food and education of her children.

loans.use: to provide maitentenace of her tailoring service and to buy more stocks like food, canned goods, noodles, bread, and coffee for her mini retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement, rods and other building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Edith Fride

texts.fr: Fride est une femme de 36ans, célibataire sans enfants. Elle a une alimentation (petit commerce general)dans laquelle elle commercialise le necessaire pour le petit déjeuné de ses voisin, les friandises, et les petits produits de première necessité pres de son domicile qu'elle gere depuis 2 ans deja. Elle a aquise et fidelise une clientele grace a sa bonne experience dans ce domaine de commercialisation de produit de consommation courante. Elle solicite ce credit pour augmenter son stock de marchandise(palettes d'eau minérale, cartons de savon, huile), afin de satisfaire sa clientele de plus en plus grandissante. Ceci lui permettra d'augmenter ses benefices qui l'aideront a grandir son activite en achetant plus de produits et en subvenant a ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Fride is a 36 year old, single, childless, woman.  She has run a small general store near her home for 2 years already.  She sells the necessities for her neighbors' breakfast, candy, and other staples. She has acquired loyal customers thanks to her experience in this field of marketing consumer products.  She is asking for this loan to increase her inventory of goods (pallets of bottled water, boxes of soap, oil) in order to satisfy her customers who are growing in number.  The loan will allow her to increase her profits which will help her grow her business by buying more products. The loan will also help her provide for her daily needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods (pallets of water, boxes of soap)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA, y departamento de Cusco.

La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y crianza de animales, la socia cría pollo y cuyes y a la venta de chicha lo realiza en su casa en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y para comprar insumos para hacer la chicha como maíz y jora. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of URUBAMBA, in the province of URUBAMBA and department of Cuzco.

Emperatriz alternates her daily activities between the business of raising animals and the business of selling chicha (a corn based drink).She raises chickens and guinea pigs in her house and sells chicha as a astreet vendor. She would like to expand her animal raising. She is asking for the loan to buy animals and to buy ingredients to make the chicha, such as corn and jora.

Emperatriz is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy animals and materials to make chicha, such as corn and jora.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Valentina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes. Valentina realiza esta actividad hace tiempo y es con esta que ha sacado adelante a sus 2  hijos, aun pequeños y dependientes de ella.  Valentina trabaja para poder darles a sus hijos una casa, alimento y educación, y por ello invertirá su préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, bebidas gaseosas etc. para su comercio de abarrotes.
La socia quiere hacer crecer su negocio y ampliar su comercio hasta convertirlo en un mini market, el cual le reportaría mejores ingresos económicos y así elevar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Valentina está muy feliz y agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
This member's name is Valentina. She belongs to the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank in the city of Cuzco – Perú. She still is a merchant who sells basic neceesity products in her small grocery store. Valentina has done this activity for a while and with it she gets her two children ahead, who are still young and dependent on her. Valentina works to give her children a home, food and education. Because of that she will invest the loan in buying merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta, soft drinks, etc. for her grocery business.

She wants to make her business grow and expand her business to become a mini-market. This will bring better income and elevate her and her family's quality of life.

Valentina is very happy and grateful to KIVA for allowing her to giver a better quality of life to her family and for helping her maintain and develop her economic activities.

loans.use: to buy merchandose such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta and soft drinks.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is a single lady aged 23 years old. Beth owns a mobile money transfer shop which has been in operation for two years. Besides this she also carries out farming. 

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to add a till float (a preset amount of cash to start business each day). Beth’s ambition is to open other outlets and the additional income from this business will help her buy house hold assets. The challenge has been with the limited float; a problem she hopes will be resolved by the loan she has applied for.

loans.use: to add a till float (a preset amount of cash to start business each day).

loans.name: Dhakriat-Althawra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dhakriat-Althawra. It consists of four ladies. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. This community is hardworking and does as much as it can in order to offer better living conditions. 

They took out a loan of 140,000 YER. Hayah is the leader of the group. She is married and 29 years old. Her educational background is a secondary school. She went through a lot of effort to save money to set up her own business selling food. It was difficult at first because she didn't know much about business, but thanks to her cleverness and desire to get ahead, she has been learning more and more. 

She took out a youth loan of 40,000 YER from to buy canned food, etc. for her business. She hopes with this loan to get more profit so that she can expand her business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy canned food, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals and vegetables for wholesale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children.

Elvira has a food/retail shop or sari-sari (convenience) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products and beverages. She had this business for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rizan

texts.en:
Rizan is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child.

Rizan has a food/retail shop or sari-sari (convenience) store where he buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products and beverages. He has had this business for four years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Rizan has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rizan hopes to improve his business and pay for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional green and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ermitania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene una pequeña picantería , la socia en su picantería ofrece diferentes platos típicos como trucha al horno con ensalada y papa doradas, rocoto relleno y otros, la socia también vende la famosa bebida de los incas la chicha a base de maíz amarillo,el sueño de la socia es mejorar y ampliar el negocio de picanteria . La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo y de algunos utensilios de cocina como platos y ollas. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA community bank in Urubamba, a province in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

She owns a small food business where she makes and sells dishes typical to this area: baked trout with a salad and fried potatoes and stuffed peppers, for example.  She also sells chicha, a traditional Incan maize-based drink.  For the future, she wants to improve and expand her food business.  She will use this loan to buy maize and kitchen utensils that she needs to continue her business.

She says that she is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Soeun's Group

texts.en:
Soeun lives in a cottage with a zinc roof in the province of Battambang. She has been selling grocery items to support her family's daily lifestyle for two years. Her husband works in Thailand as a construction worker. Soeun is 43 years old and has three children, one of whom is still in school. 

The business earns her less than $25 per day and at the end of the day she manages to save around $1.50. This is the first time Soeun has borrowed money from VisionFund. 

Soeun is the leader of a two-member group that has applied for a loan to buy grocery products such as garlic, soft drinks, sugar, salt, gasoline and so on. From this loan, Soeun hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She also hopes her youngest son can remain in school.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Higidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA, y departamento de Cusco.

La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de confecciones, ella confeccionan pantalones, blusas y ternos a pedido del público en general, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de taller de confecciones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para confeccionar como tela, hilos y cierres. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA community bank in Urubamba, a province in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

She operates a clothes-making business.  She makes suits, pants and blouses, to order.  She normally works from 8:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening.  The business is her means of supporting herself and getting ahead in the world.  She says that her goal is to expand her business and that she will use this loan to buy the supplies that she needs--cloth, thread, buttons, etc.--to grow.

She says, too, that she is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy materials for her clothes-making business.

loans.name: Soben's Group

texts.en:
Soben is 47 years old and a married mother of five, three of whom work at garment factory and help their father with the construction business. Her husband runs a small business of home construction in the community. To assist in supporting the family, Soben makes Cambodian sweets for sale, and she has been selling these kinds of sweets for over ten years. 

Soben is an old customer of VisionFund. She and her group member have been with VisionFund for five loan cycles, and they are now applying for their sixth loan after their previous obligations have been completely repaid. As the group leader, Soben will use her portion to (1) buy ingredients for making sweets for sale and (2) to buy construction materials for her husband's business. Soben hopes that this loan will enable her family to make more income so they can live in a better condition.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making Cambodian sweets and to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es músico de profesión y es también artesano, el socio elabora diferentes trabajos y muchos de ellos los compra ya hecho y los vende en Urubamba, el socio nos comenta que le apasiona la música razón por la cual lo llevo a formar su propio grupo musical siendo el cantante principal,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de musico. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su grupo musical.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA community bank in Urubamba, a province in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

He is a musician, by profession, and an artist.  He operates a retail business, buying and selling in Urubama, to make ends meet, but his passion is music.  He is the lead singer in a band that he started and his dream is to build a performance business.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy sound equipment for the band. 

He says that he is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for his performance business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.

El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en un hotel en el área de jardinería, el es cuidante de todo el área de jardinería sembrando diferentes flores y también el socio se dedica al negocio de ganadería, el es propietario de vacas y lo vende en las diferentes ferias del distrito de Urubamba, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados y también mejorar en su trabajo en el área de jardinería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para las vacas y para comprar una vaca. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA community bank in Urubamba, a province in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

He is a gardener at a local hotel.  He plants and cares for the flowers there.  He also operates a livestock business.  He raises cattle and sells them at the market in Urubamba.  For the future, he wants to grow his livestock business and improve his gardening skills.  He will use this loan to buy a cow and animal feed for his livestock business.

He says that he is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal feed for his livestock business.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de maiz,la socia tiene un terreno donde siembra maiz y lo vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el maiz.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la chacra de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA community bank in Urubamba, a province in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

She makes her living buying and selling maize.  She has a small farm where she grows maize and she sells what she harvests at local markets.  She works from 8 in the morning to 6 in the evening.  For the future, she wants to open a store where she can sell maize.  She will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

She says that she is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fund the purchase of equipment and supplies

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan, 44 years old, is originally from the Sangke district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has seven children, two of whom are still in school. Some of the other five children are staying with her and helping the family's business while some are working at a factory in Thailand. 

To manage her daily expenses in the household, she has been involved in rice farming for 20 years. Phan has been with VisionFund for nine cycles. The past eight loans, which she has completely paid back, have helped her to relieve her family's burden and maintain the current business. 

In continuing a good business, she is now leading a group of three female members to apply for a new loan. Her requesting amount is 1,400,000 KHR; another member is seeking 700,000 KHR as her ninth loan cycle also, and the remaining one is applying for 500,000 KHR as her fourth loan cycle. 

For Phan, the loan portion will be used to buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her rice field. She hopes to sell her cash crop at a high price so as to improve her profit and improve her family’s condition.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a businessman. He runs one of the busiest Mobile Money Transfer shops in Lusaka. He has been running his shop for six months. This is his story....

I am a hardworking 26-year-old young man with an Accountant’s diploma. Through my tertiary education, I have wanted to grow a business and affect my world positively. I have worked with two banks previously in the retail, marketing and sales aspects and have developed great business skills such as direct marketing. I am where I am today because I have been opening my heart to new challenges and opportunities.

My business deals in the receiving and sending of money countrywide.  I feel it is a service that impacts positively in my city because it is accommodating to people from all walks of life. Anyone can walk into my shop and be comfortable to transact business with me. 

On a daily basis, I have over three hundred people come to my shop to send and receive money. However, I only serve about a hundred and fifty of them. This is because I do not have enough working capital to satisfy them all. The situation worsens when it is the end of the month, as that is the time of the month when most people in Lusaka get paid. I tend to have even more people come to transact money transfers. It is for this reason that I am taking out a loan. This loan will have a very big impact on my business because I will be able to serve all my customers and this will stimulate my revenue.

Getting this loan will also change my personal life. I will earn more profits and this will help me to finally move out of my parents' house and fulfill my responsibilities of helping out my family members.

loans.use: To increase his working capital so that he does not have to send away half of his customers

loans.name: Nomin-Erdene

texts.en:
Mrs. Nomin-Erdene, 34, sells women's clothes out of her rental stall. She has been running her business for 5 years and lives with her family in her old house in the 'ger' district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, spotty electricity and including Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She wants to repair her house. 

In winter, her house becomes cold and has a heat loss through the some parts of the house. Her house roof is made of lead and it has been bad and old, has a heat loss, emission and water drops. The walls and door have been damaged a lot and became very bad, so she is planning to replace all of them at once. She will do wall insulation with foam, sand and cement and install a new wooden door. Then she will replace the roof with a metal board one.

This all will cost about MNT 3,000,000 in the construction materials market in Mongolia. She totally believes her family can live in comfort and stay warm at home in winter after the repair. She is requesting a loan to buy building materials including metal board roof, a wooden door and wall insulation materials for her house repair.

loans.use: To buy building materials including metal board roof, wooden door and wall insulation materials for her house repair.

loans.name: Tsedenbal

texts.en:
Tsedenbal, 59, is a pensioner. He used to work as a military man for many years. Now he runs a taxi for the extra earnings for his family. He lives with his wife and his daughter; most of his children have moved out from their parent’s home. 

His family owns an old house in the ger district (a ger is a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt) of Kherlen town, an eastern town in Mongolia. Lately his house has been in bad repair and he can’t always make any big repairs to his house due to the money shortage. Especially, some parts of his house roof have been broken by wind and rains in the past. This creates heat loss and it costs much to buy the coal to warm his home in winter. In Mongolia, winter is very cold and harsh; most Mongolians use coal to warm their home because there is little forest and wood sources. 

Tsedenbal knows that using the coal fuel is very harmful to the health of people and the environment, so he decided to repair his roof within this summer. He needs about MNT 500,000 to buy the building materials for his house roof repair. His son will support him in repairing it.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his house roof repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya, 41, works as a janitress in a company office. She is a widow and lives with her two children in her bad house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. It has not had any complete repair since it was built. In winter heat loss and emission happens to her old house through the roof and walls. She and her brother together made a small repair to them, but still it is happening, so she decided to make the repair by professional builders before this coming winter. 

Her family has been using the too much coal and other kind of fuels just to stay warm at their home in winter for many years.  She knows it is the worst thing to their health and the environment. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to buying building materials to do insulation and make repairs to her house walls and roof and cover the cost for hired builders.

loans.use: To buy building materials to do insulation and make repairs to her house walls and roof and cover the cost for hired builders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya, 47, works as a janitor in the military unit. Actually, she is an engineer, but she has not been employed through her major since she  graduated. Her monthly salary is low and her husband works with her as a watchman in same military unit. 

She lives with her husband and her son, 16, in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity where the Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts are found in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. 

Her family owns a small and old house, which was built many years ago. In winter they feel cold due to the bad walls without insulation. Her family members always have colds and get sick due to the cold at home. 

She wants to insulate her house walls. It will cost about 1,500,000 MNT to buy the building materials and cover the cost of a hired builder.

loans.use: To buy building materials and cover the cost of a hired builder.

loans.name: Regoberta

texts.en:
Regoberta is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Regoberta has a shop that sells motor parts. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase additional motor parts to resell.

Regoberta is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Regoberta hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more motor parts to resell.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
	Ousmane habite à environ 16 km de  l’institution, marié et père de famille il travaille à longueur de journée de 7 h à 18 h pour faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et à la scolarité de ses enfants. Il évolue dans le maraichage depuis plus de 15 ans et il demande un prêt de 500 000 f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
Mr Ousmane est à son troisième prêt, pour les prêts antérieurs il a respecté ses engagements vis-à-vis de l’IMF, avec une bonne récolte il pourra payer la scolarité de ses enfants  et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de  la famille.IL veut un jour avoir son propre champ et produire plus.
texts.en:
Ousmane lives approximately 16 kilometers from the institution. He is a married father of a family, and works throughout the day from 7 am to 6 pm to pay for his family's daily expenses and his children's education. He has worked in market gardening for more than 15 years, and has requested a 500,000-franc loan. The loan will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers.

This is Ousmane's third loan, and he has respected his repayment commitments with the institution for his previous loans. With a good harvest he will be able to pay for his children's education, as well as to improve his family's food conditions. One day he would like to have his own field, and to produce more.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers so he has a good harvest

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 24 years old and has one child. She sells different types of clothes. She has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she wants to add more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. She is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her to run the business smoothly as well as taking care of the family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Serigne Mor

texts.fr:
	Mr  Sergine Mor habite à environ 18 km de la ville principale, marié et père de famille il veille toujours à s’assurer de la dépense quotidienne.
IL  s’active dans l’aviculture depuis plus de 15 ans  et travaille de 8 h à 20 h.IL achète des poussins qu’il élève pour ensuite les revendre à ses clients, il demande un crédit de 250 000f. Avec  le  bénéfice il compte épargner et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.IL veut un jour renforcer son fond de roulement en vue d’augmenter sa production.
texts.en: Mr. Serigne Mor lives roughly 18km from the main town. Married and head of the household, he always sees to it that the daily expenses are provided for. He has been working in poultry farming for more than 15 years and works from 8am until 8pm. He purchases chicks, which he raises to then sell to his clients. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 CFA francs. With the profits, he plans to save and to meet the needs of his family. He would one day like to increase his working capital with an eye to increasing production.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, raise them, then sell them.

loans.name: Bat-Orgil

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Orgil, 39, runs a taxi around Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been running his business for 8 years nonstop. His wife Tserennadmid operates a grocery store in their backyard. They live an the old, bad house which was built in the socialist era. Now it has become very old and it has lots of damage to every part, so he decided to build his family a new house. He needs about 2,400,000 MNT to buy building materials for his new house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his new house.

loans.name: Enfants De Jesus Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENFANTS DE JESUS est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Carine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Carine est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Simon. Carine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Carine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Carine vend depuis treize ans des divers produits (conserves) dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Carine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Carine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENFANTS DE JESUS, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur  a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The group Enfants de Jesus is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group is requesting financial aid from Alidé in order to increase their level of business. The representative of this group, Carine, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. Carine is 29 years old and is married to a mason named Simon. Carine did not attend school. The couple has four children under their care, some of whom are in school. Carine lives with her husband and children. The couple share the various household responsibilities. To contribute to meeting the needs of their home, Carine has been selling various products (canned goods) in a Bénin market for 13 years. This business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. Carine gets her supplies in a Bénin city. In the quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her revenue and income, Carine and the other members of the group Enfants de Jesus are requesting a second loan from Alidé. Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy various products (canned goods).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Jesselyn is providing motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Jesselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Jesselyn hopes to improve her services for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Forward Group

texts.en:
The group called Forward is made up of one man and one woman; both are traders. They are Eric and Freda. They are into the sale of plastic products, underwear and lining material. This is their 3rd loan cycle with ID-Ghana and they have been in these businesses for 8 years. Both operate the business at their residence.

Freda, 36 years old and married with three children, sells plastic products like chairs, cups and bowls. She is doing this business because her husband is not making enough money to cater for the family; therefore, she needs to assist her husband financially. Her husband is a civil servant whilst her children are of school-going ages.

Her profit capacity monthly is 100 cedis. She, together with Eric, repaid previous loans promptly. She needs 700 Ghana cedis and Eric 450 Ghana cedis.

They need the total amount of 1,150 Ghana cedis to be able to maintain their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more plastic chairs, cups and bowls so that she can make profit and assist her husband in providing family needs.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
	Mr Cheikh habite à quelques  kilomètres  de la ville principale, marié et père de famille, en plus de vouloir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille, il appuie son père aux dépenses quotidiennes de la maison.
 Il s’active  dans le transport depuis plus de 6 ans et  a un parc automobile  où il met les voitures d’occasion qu’il achète  pour les retaper avant de les revendre. Soucieux de toutes  ses  charges il travaille de 8 h à 19 h .Mr Cheikh  demande un crédit de 500 000 f pour compléter  la somme d’une  voiture déjà marchandée, il compte avec le bénéfice qu’il aura de la vente appuyer financièrement  son père et sa famille, épargner une partie. Mr CHEIKH veut agrandir un jour son parc automobile afin de gagner plus d’argent.
texts.en:
Cheikh lives several kilometers from the main city, and is a married father with a family. He wants to improve his family's food conditions, and also supports his own father with the daily household expenses.

Cheikh has worked in transportation for more than six years, and has a car park where he keeps the second-hand cars he buys. In the park he refurbishes his cars, before reselling them. Concerned about all his expenses, he works from 8 am until 7 pm. He has requested a loan of 500,000 francs to make up the money he needs to buy a second-hand car on which he has already agreed a price. With the profits he will make from the sale, he plans to support his father and family financially, as well as to save some money. Cheikh wants to expand his car park one day, so he can earn more money.

loans.use: to make up the money he needs to buy a second-hand car on which he has already agreed a price, which he will refurbish before reselling

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, 48, is a resident from a rural area of Moung Russey District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has 8 children, six of whom are dependent on her. Not much different from the other villagers, Neang and her husband are also farmers. She has managed 5 hectares of farmland for growing rice for six years and currently she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day in order to provide a daily sustenance for her family. However, the shortage of water supply remains the key challenge for her. 

Neang joined VisionFund one cycle ago. She used her past loan in an effective way for making a constant income to meet the daily basic needs in the family. Now she leads a group of two women to apply for a new loan in order to boost her crop yield. She and the other member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. For her loan portion, she will buy fertilizer and rice seed for her paddy field; a portion of it will be used in purchasing gasoline for water pumping and to pay for plowing fees, too. She hopes to grow her cash-crop in a timely manner, so she can make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and gasoline, and pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Elvira has a shop that makes and sells mementos or giveaways for events such as weddings, birthdays, christenings, and baptisms. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw materials used in making these items. Elvira is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make event mementos

loans.name: Sedjro 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDJRO 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies pratiquant les mêmes activités. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sourou Omontayo Angéline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sourou Omontayo Angéline est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Sourou Omontayo Angéline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sourou Omontayo Angéline est mariée à un certain Alphonse. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer ses diverses charges, Sourou Omontayo Angéline vend depuis cinq ans de la nourriture (riz accompagné de friture) à son domicile. Sourou Omontayo Angéline s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sourou Omontayo Angéline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEDJRO 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Sedjro 1 Group is made up of three women who are friends running the same type of business. The group's representative, named Sourou Omontayo Angéline, is the woman with her hand raised in the photo.

Sourou Omontayo Angéline is 41 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a man named Alphonse. The couple has four children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are in their care. They live together with their children. The couple sees to the various household expenses together.

In order to provide for their various expenses, Sourou Omontayo Angéline has been selling food (rice accompanied by fritters) from her home for five years. She gets her supplies in her area. With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing her sales and her income, Sourou Omontayo Angéline, along with the other members of the Sedjro 1 Group, is seeking a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Alleluia Group

texts.fr: «ALLELUIA» est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Akouavi Blandine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans. Akouavi Blandine est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Raffic. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Akouavi Blandine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Akouavi Blandine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Akouavi Blandine mène comme activité la vente des sous-vêtements dans son quartier. Akouavi Blandine s'approvisionne au Togo. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Akouavi Blandine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe «ALLELUIA» un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Alleluia is a group of 3 people who are friends. The group's representative, Akouavi Blandine (whose hand is raised in the picture) is 30 years old. She is married to a reseller called Raffic. The couple have 2 dependent children, one of whom goes to school. Akouavi Blandine lives together with her husband and children and she and her husband both take care of the household expenses. Akouavi Blandine did not got to school. In order to meet her various responsibilities, she sells underwear in her neighbourhood. She gets her supplies in Togo.

In order to better respond to the demands of her growing clientèle and to earn more profits, Akouavi Blandine is requesting, together with the other members of the Alleluia group, a 3rd loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en: Ang was born in 1976 and lives with her husband and her two daughters, both of whom are students. They live in a rural village of Battambang province. Ang's group consists of three members and two of them are new to VisionFund while Ang is an existing client with three loan cycles which are completely paid back. Ang was appointed to be group leader by her members and she requested the loan to buy fish for sale as she has been in this business for many years to support her family. With the support from this loan, Ang hopes to make more income so that she can feed  her family better.

loans.use: To buy fish for sale

loans.name: Vidalita

texts.en: Vidalita is an active member of PMPC.  She is 42 years old, married with four adult children.  She is residing in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She joined PMPC in 2011.  Her livelihood is selling snacks, having average monthly earnings of Php 3,000.  She took another loan in PMPC to buy additional raw materials to make snacks for sale.  She plans to use the profit to save in PMPC and expand her business.

loans.use: to acquire addtional raw materials to make snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children. 

Richard is providing motorcycle services. He has had this business for 9 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Richard has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Richard hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
Age 32 years, Sovann is one of the villagers in the Sangke district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has one daughter and one son who are still in school.

Sovann has upgraded her family's living conditions with income from rice farming as her main source of income, with a huge labor support from her husband. She supplements her income by selling sweets. Nonetheless, the low crop yield remains a huge challenge for her.

This is the fifth loan cycle for Sovann with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has managed the past four loans with success in keeping all of her children in school and in leasing an additional plot for growing more paddy rice. Now, her group is made up of three female members - two other members are third loan cycle clients.

Sovann is taking a loan of 1,400,000 Cambodia Riels (KHR), while the other two members are requesting 600,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Sovann will use her entire loan portion to pay for the harvesting fee for her paddy field. She expects to earn more income so as to uplift her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting fee for her paddy field.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronilla lives in Mombasa town with her family, including her husband and their four children. Petronilla has been selling clothes which has been a profitable project. Thanks for her hard work; she has accumulated some money which she wants to to invest in her newly established cafe. She however continues with her clothes selling business. 

Petronilla sells a variety of dishes in her cafe. Demand for more foods which she did not offer has risen but she lacks enough funds to meet these needs. She is therefore requesting another loan in the amount of Ksh 30,000 to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, potatoes, etc. Petronilla plans to start a charcoal-selling business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Denver

texts.en:
Denver is 21 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.

Denver is providing motorcycle services. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Denver has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Denver hopes to improve his services so he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is a new member of PMPC.  She is 61 years of age with 3 adult children.  She engaged in raising pigs in her backyard, having an average monthly income of Php 3,500.  She joined PMPC to have financial access to purchase feed and medicines.  Jesusa believes that with God's help, the living standard of the family will be improved someday.

loans.use: to purchase  feed and medicines

loans.name: Essossinada Group

texts.fr: Père de 06 enfants dont 05 scolarisés, Mr Abdoulaye est né en 1976. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille il a commencé par cultiver la terre depuis 2009 pour avoir de bons rendements, vendre et avoir des bénéfices. 06 personnes lui viennent en aide pour l’avancement de son activité basée en RÉGION CENTRALE. Avec ce second crédit qu’il sollicite, il voudrait s’approvisionner en engrais. Mr Abdoulaye veut augmenter sa superficie cultivable et voir sa famille s’épanouir. Il est nommé pour être responsable du groupement « ESSOSSINADA » constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui ont mis leur foi enla terre. Ils cultivent tous du maïs.
texts.en: The father of six children, five of whom attend school, Mr. Abdoulaye was born in 1976.   In order to better meet the needs of his family, he began farming in 2009 with good yields for his income.  Six people work for him to keep his business, based in the Central region, growing.  With this second loan that he is requesting, he would like to stock up on fertilizer.  Mr. Abdoulaye would like to increase the size of his farm and to see his family thrive.  He has been named the leader of the “ESSOSSINADA” group, made up of women and men who have put their faith in the earth.  They all grow corn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
 
Gina is buying and selling fruits like 'rambotan', 'lansones' and 'marang'. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more fruits to re-sell.

Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to re-sell

loans.name: Bukhtumur

texts.en: Mr. Bukhtumur is a pensioner and his family owns an old house. This winter he decided to live in that house. He is one of our good lenders and this time he is requesting a loan to dedicate to adding wall insulation to his old house before the winter.

loans.use: to add wall insulation to his old house before the winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a God-fearing woman who lives with her husband and their son who recently joined a preparatory school. Mgeni operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables such as bananas, cabbages, etc. She has been involved in this business for several years and she narrates that she has been doing well. She says that the previous loan enabled her to increase her merchandise. This is her second loan which she intends to invest in her existing business. With this loan, Mgeni intends to renovate her store and add stock of potatoes, onions, cabbages, etc. Her business is located at a strategic business area, and her primary customers are local residents.

Perishability of her products continues to be a nightmare to her.

loans.use: to renovate her store and add stock of potatoes, onions, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Mariapia

texts.en:
Mariapia, 32, sells clothes door to door. In addition, she manages a motorcycle taxi which earns her a good income. This young, hardworking woman lives in Likoni in a rental house. Her spouse is a primary school teacher and together they are blessed with three children. 

She’s been in this business for seven years now and does very well. She sells different fashions of clothes; whatever the customer requests. 

Mariapia comments that her greatest problem is theft of her products. The loan she’s asking for is to buy bundles of clothes for sale. In the future she’d like to open a boutique. She also hopes to ensure her children are educated.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en: Flordelisa is a new member of PMPC.  She is 44 years of age, widowed having 4 children.  Two of them are adult and the remaining are 16 and 14 years old.  She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business for 2 years with a monthly income of Php 5,000.  She took a loan in PMPC to have additional capital to acquire grocery stock for sale.  She is planning to use the profit to improve the business and save for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn  is  45  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Evelyn  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 14  years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Evelyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 24 years old; she is single and she lives in a rental house in the city. This entrepreneur is a responsible and hard-working person with good values. She runs a food vending business that is located in her place of residence, a working activity she started 2 years ago after finishing school. She has succeeded in overcoming many difficulties thanks to her tenacity and responsibility. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of rice, wheat flour, beans, etc.

She hopes to repay her loan on time so as to ask for more loans to invest in her business and move forward.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, wheat flour, beans, etc.

loans.name: Dormelita

texts.en: Dormelita  is  36  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Dormelita  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7  years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Dormelita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Dormelita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 34 years old, comes from Kisumu, and is married to Caleb. They have five children aged between three and 18 years.

Patricia sells potatoes, a business she has been doing for the last one year and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

She is now taking out her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy  more stock of potatoes from farmers for sale. She plans to use her profits to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy  more stock of potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is 46 years old and lives with his life partner and their three children. He is a hard-working person who has been selling fresh fruits for the past 20 years. Said owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. His spouse is a businesswoman. He says the perishable and seasonal nature of his products are the major drawbacks of his business. Said is working hard to educate his children, all of whom are still in primary school.

Said is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy fruit, such as mangoes and oranges. He sells his fruit in one of the municipal markets. He would like to carry out this work with diligence so that he can improve the family's quality of life. He says that this will give him a more comfortable home for his young ones.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, such as mangoes and oranges, to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia does farming in Nyahururu town and it has been profitable. She is 59 years old and married with six children.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer for planting during this planting season. With the anticipated profits she plans to improve her family's living standards.

In the future, Virginia hopes to grow her farming business by planting more cash crops and thereby make more income.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma  is  32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Gemma  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5  years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Gemma  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 37 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.

Annabelle is selling RTW's or ready to wear items in their local community. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of RTW's to sell like blouses,  T-shirts and pants.

Annabelle is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more Ready-To-Wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Benjelyn

texts.en:
Benjelyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Benjelyn offers a machine for making animal feeds. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools for the maintenance of the machine.
Benjelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Benjelyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of an animal feed machine.

loans.name: Byron

texts.en:
Byron is a 32-year-old single man from the Kajulu area of Kisumu and has no dependents.

Byron operates a retail shop selling household items, he has been operating this business for the last six months and  earns a monthly income of KES. 5,000. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy sugar and cooking oil for sale. He will use profits to grow and stabilize the business.

His dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar and cooking oil for his retail shop.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 44 years old and is a new micro-finance member of PMPC. She is married with three adult children. She sells the fish caught by her husband and other fishermen in the village. She joined PMPC to have additional money to buy more fish to sell. She wants to use the profit to improve the living condition of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 32 years old, married to Nelvi and blessed with two children ages 9 and 10. He provides transport services through his motorbike business he started two years ago. Dennis earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He wants to purchase another motorbike and has requested a second loan of KES 40,000. The profit he makes from his businesses will help him open a new line of business for her wife. His dream is to see his business expand to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Wendolin Jaqueline

texts.es:
Wendolin tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea cerca al municipio de Villanueva, Cortes.
Hace 12 años que ella estableció su propio taller de confección de prendas de vestir como pantalones, vestidos, trajes, blusas, faldas y ropa como forros de muebles, sabanas y cortinas. Anteriormente trabajo en una fábrica de maquila y allí adquirió la experiencia. Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales como telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes, etc. para la confección de ropa.  Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener el negocio estable para la obtención de ingresos necesarios para su familia. Su meta es siempre mantener activo su negocio ya que es su fuente de ingresos de donde mantiene a su familia y también quiere sentirse realizada como persona.
texts.en:
Wendolin, age 37, is a single mother, and she has three children.  She lives in a village close to the Villanueva municipality in Cortes.

Twelve years ago she established her own shop for making clothes like pants, dresses, suits, blouses, skirts, and furniture slipcovers, sheets, and curtains.  She used to work in a factory, and that is where she got her experience.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials like fabric, thread, elastic, and lace in order to make clothes.  This investment will help her keep her business stable, and it will help her get the income her family needs.  Her goal is to always keep her business active.  This is because it is her source of income to support her family.  Also, she wants to feel fulfilled as a person.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, elastic, and lace to stock her seamstress shop.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is a mother of two dependent sons. She is originally from a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Cambodia.

Sreymom overcomes her family's hardship with the crop yield that she has received from her rice cropping business on three hectares of farmland. It is the only business that she has had and she has been with it for 10 years. However, the drought is the main challenge for her, which made her crop fruitless. From her current business, she can earn only 13,000 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day.

Sreymom and her other group member are new to VisionFund for this cycle and Sreymom is the group leader. She and her group member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR and 1,500,000 KHR, respectively. She will use her portion to buy six sacks of fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for harvesting fees. She hopes to increase her productivity to earn more income, so she can set aside some money to buy a mini tracker to support her farmland.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for harvesting fees.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio se dedica al trabajo en un hotel,el socio es conductor del carro en el hotel,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es tener su propio carro.El socio solicita el credito para renovar su brevete para manejar el carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Cristo Asencio De Rumichaca communal bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

The borrower works at a hotel.  He drives the hotel’s car, and he works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  It is through this work that he wants to get ahead.

The borrower’s dream is to have his own car.  He is requesting the loan in order to renew his driver’s license.  He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une femme de 51 ans,veuve,mère de 05 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 23 et 32 ans.Un de ses enfants va encore à l'école.Elle a également sous sa charge deux de ses petits-fils.Elle est commerçante dans une banlieue depuis 05 ans où elle vend des draps.Elle achète des tissus qu'elle transforme dans le but de confectionner des draps draps.Son activité fonctionne assez bien,car grâce à son expérience en couture elle a pu conquérir une clientèle considérable.Mais cependant le fait qu'elle ne vend que des draps est un problème car la clientèle demande de plus en plus d'autres articles de literie tels les taies oreillers et autres et elle ne parvient pas à les satisfaire car  la petitesse son capital ne lui permet pas d'allouer une partie pour la confection de ces autres articles,ce qui ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement cette clientèle.Elle voudrait donc ce crédit pour acheter des tissus en grande quantité qui l'aideront à confectionner d'autres articles de literie ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire à bien sa clientèle et augmentera ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui l'aideront à développer son activité en achetant plus de tissus afin de confectionner plus d'articles de literie,mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 51-year-old widow, mother of five children whose range between 23 and 32 years old. One of her children still attends school. She is also responsible for two of her grandsons.

For five years, she has been a storekeeper in a suburb where she sells sheets. She buys fabric that she transforms with the aim to make sheets. Her business runs quite well. Thanks to her experience in sewing she has been able to win a significant number of customers. However, the fact that she only sells sheets is a problem because her customers are asking for more and more other bedding items such as pillowcases and others. She is not able to meet their demand because her small working capital does not allow her to allocate a portion to the making of different bedding items. She cannot properly meet her customers’ demand.

She would like this loan to buy large quantities of fabric that will help her to make other bedding items. This will allow her to meet her customers’ demand and increase her profit. The profit will help her grow her business by buying more fabric in order to make more bedding items, but also to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de frejoles y tambien la socia vende chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz,tanto los frejoles como la chicha vende en el mercado,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,anteriormente la socia se dedica al negocio tienda de abarrotes,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender frejoles y chicha.La socia solicita el credito para comprar frejoles y comprar maiz para preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the Cristo Asención De Rumichaca communal bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Florencia sells beans.  She also sells “chicha”, which is a corn based drink.  She sells beans as much as she sells the chicha.  She sells at the market, and she works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She used to have a grocery store business.

Her dream is to have a place where she can sell beans and chicha.  She is requesting  the loan to buy beans and to buy corn to prepare the chicha.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy beans and to buy corn to prepare the chicha.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Antonia has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, in which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Antonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is 42 years old, married and, has four children. He has worked as a mechanic since 1989. This long experience gives him a special place in this area as he is recommended and supported by his customers.

Nasser is requesting his fifth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy new tools and spare parts. All of his previous loans were invested in his business in a well managed way. Nasser hopes to continue to expand his business and increase his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is 34 years old man from Kisumu City, is married to Lilian and they have two children aged seven and five years.

Sylvester operates a stall where he sells onions and has been doing this for the last three years. He makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. 


He is now taking out his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy a stock of onions for sale. His profits will be used to educate his children and also cater for other expenses in the business. His dream is to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of onions for sale.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 43-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been working in providing electricity to his villagers since 1992. This kind of business is essential in his region, and all over Lebanon, because it's a big problem that has no solution at the present time.

Tarek is working on improving and changing his power cables and network to keep his customers pleased with the service he provides, that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new cables and renew his network.

Tarek is hoping to expand his working region through buying more power generators in the future to start providing electricity to neighboring villages at competitive prices. He hopes to keep on providing his family the best living ever, in addition to higher education.

Tarek was an employee until two years ago in 2010, when he decided to buy the generator from his boss and start his own business to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To support his power supply business with doing necessary maintenance to his cables and networks

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 40-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children. He has owned a bakery since 2003, and has 22 years of experience in this field. 

As mentioned before, he serves the famous traditional Manoucheh with special toppings (cheese, thyme, spicy cheese, meat, etc.) He is talented in his business and his customers enjoy the tasty foods he creates.

Marwan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, for the second time, in order to buy necessary raw materials for his bakery such as oil, cheese, thyme and flour, in addition to completing floor tiles in his house. Marwan is sure that it will have a great positive effect on his business in addition to his family's social and financial situation, as the first loan did. 

Marwan is still planning to expand his business through moving to a larger place to accommodate eat-in customers.

loans.use: to buy  necessary raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Javier Gregorio

texts.es: Javier de 23 años de edad, encontró en la venta de pescado y queso, la alternativa de ingresos para ayudar al sustento de su hogar, pues su madre quedó viuda hace dos años.  El cada dos días va a un puerto ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad,  compra y   reparte pescado entre sus clientes a los que previamente ha hecho su preventa. Sus principales clientes son vecinos del sector y referidos de otros sectores, que ha logrado convertir en clientes fijos, debido a las condiciones de frescura del producto.  Javier también ha incursionado en la venta de queso y lo distribuye en tiendas y familias que lo compran por kilos. En la medida en que su clientela conoce la calidad con los que trata estos productos, hacen más solicitudes, pero su capital de trabajo se convierte en el primer desafío por superar, pues no alcanza a cubrir a “todo el que le haga un pedido”; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, pescado y queso. Con su credikiva aumentará su capital de trabajo y con ello el volumen de sus ventas de contado, para traer más bienestar a su familia pues finalmente esa es su gran meta.
texts.en:
Javier is 23 years old and found himself selling fish and cheese as an alternative means of income to help support the household as his mother was widowed two years ago. Every two days he goes to a port located 2 hours from the city. He buys and distributes fish to his customers who have pre-purchased it. His principal customers are neighbors in his area and those referred from other areas whom he has been able to convert into regulars owing to the freshness of his product. 

Javier has also started selling cheese and he distributes it to both stores and families who buy it by the kilo. As his customer base gets to know the quality of these products they place more orders, but his working capital is the first obstacle to overcome. He doesn't have enough to cover "the entire amount that may be ordered," and this is the reason why he went to CrediKiva. This is his first financing, made by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy fish and cheese wholesale. With his CrediKiva he'll increase his working capital and with it his sales volume, in order to bring greater well-being to his family as, in the end, this is his most main goal.

loans.use: to buy fish and cheese, wholesale.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana sigue soltera y sigue viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
